column4: Hello. I am on Ubuntu 9.04, I run Pidgin 2.5.5 and Pidgin-Audacious 2.0.0 doesn't work. It just doesn't change my status.
I am on Ubuntu 9.04, I run Pidgin 2.5.5 and Pidgin-Audacious 2.0.0 doesn't work. It just doesn't change my status.
you do not need to say it multiple times
is this audacious po=ligin a thing that says what song you are listening to by any chance?
it is a pidgin plugin, btw, not an audacious one
and you are listening to the music on audacious, and not rythmbox (right, kinda obvious)

I have not used this before, so I guess I can't help much, but a good way to figure out exactly what the problem is, is to go to the website for the project (google it will usualy do it) and then read how to set it up, and see where things start going wrong, if it is a pidgen PLUGIN, then you might need to change the settings in pigden
I have set Pidgin to let this plugin to update my status but it doesn't do so. Anyway, I will look at their website, thank you. :)
just had an idea, if you go into pidgen, and then go to status (a drop down menu) is there an option for "my song"
Here is what I found, though: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/pidgin-audacious/+bug/217949
read the second to last post in the launchpad
Yeah, I did so. I guess I won't get into such trouble, I 'll wait for an official fix. Thanks, though. :-)
